words.def: a member of the ancient Germanic peoples who spread from the Rhine into the Roman Empire in the 4th century
A knot or burl in a tree; a knurl, a gnarl.
an informer or spy working for the police
a row or line of people (especially soldiers or police) standing abreast of one another
The twenty-second letter of the Arabic alphabet.
(Judaism) sacred chest where the ancient Hebrews kept the two tablets containing the Ten Commandments
a device for creating a current of air by movement of a surface or surfaces
a terrorist organization that seeks to overthrow the government dominated by Tutsi and to institute Hutu control again
move fast by using one's feet, with one foot off the ground at any given time
the syllable naming the fourth (subdominant) note of the diatonic scale in solmization
a colorless and odorless inert gas
a silvery soft waxy metallic element of the alkali metal group
